data.assessmentTitle: Texas English Language Proficiency Assessment System (TELPAS) Alternate
Texas English Language Proficiency Assessment System (TELPAS)

data.description: In the beginning stages of learning English
Use common, basic academic English, but need considerable support
Understand and use academic English with some support
Use academic English with little support
Composite rating is lower or the same as the previous year
Composite rating is one level higher than the previous year's
Composite rating is two levels higher than the previous year
Composite rating is three levels higher than the previous year
Composite rating is four levels higher than the previous year
Aware of English sounds or print but have little or no functional ability to participate in communication activities
Match and imitate English to participate in routine communication activities in familiar settings, but need significant linguistic accommodations
Understand short messages, produce one- or two-word messages, and are starting to participate in linguistically accommodated activities in familiar settings
Understand longer messages, produce simple, messages, and participate meaningfully in linguistically accommodated activities in familiar settings
Understand and produce more detailed messages and participate independently in communication activities in familiar setting
